chapter.para: The JAIN SLEE &THIS.ENABLER; Enabler allows JAIN SLEE Applications to interact with SIP Presence Servers, hiding the network protocol complexity. The Enabler consists of SBB, which can be used in child relations, with a simple synchronous interface.
Enabler abstracts communication described in RFC3265.
The SIP Presence Server is a functional element used to manage UA status. Server performs following tasks:

listitem.para: Manages publications from one or more presence source(s) of a certain presentity. This includes refreshing presence information, replacing existing presence information with newly-published information, or removing presence information
Manages subscriptions from watchers to presence information and generates notifications about presence information state changes, and retrieves the presence authorization rules from the XDM Server
Manages subscriptions from watcher information subscribers to watcher information and generates notifications about watcher information state changes
